channel.title: Quantic Dream's "Kara" Tech Demo
channel.description:
So Quantic Dream has just shown a tech demo of their new game engine for PS3 at GDC, with a 7 minute video called "Kara".
[url='https://www.eurogamer.net/videos/first-look-at-heavy-rain-dev-new-tech-video']Watch it here.[/url]
Very impressive stuff and although the graphics seem to have only been slightly improved from Heavy Rain, the facial animation tech is definitely much improved, now showing a tongue that actually moves and realistic teeth shaders.
I give a lot more value to a true geometrical approach to facial animation like this than LA Noire's method of superimposing video over geometry, that while is technically much more precise, it also is kinda cheating.

item.title: Quantic Dream's "Kara" Tech Demo
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

I still need to play Persona 3…

I own it (regular, not FES) on PS2, and “acquired” it on PSP.

On topic: the animation was pretty good, if not slightly out of sync with the audio.

There’s a few differences between versions.

P3 standard is obviously the original version of the game.

P3FES is a re-release on PS2 with additional Personas and a 30+ hour epilogue called “The Answer.” Fans criticized it for derailing characters and a lack of the social link gameplay that defined the original game (“The Journey” segment).

Persona 3 Portable (P3P) is the most radically different of the three versions. The extra Personas from P3FES are present but not “The Answer.” The battle system gets some tweaks from Persona 4, allowing direct teammate control and the ability to guard (which makes combat a whole lot more controllable). The anime cutscenes are sadly reduced to panning across still frames from them and the full 3D school exploration was cut due to space constraints, but going between the locations is faster due to the new perspective and graphics. Tartarus (the main dungeon) is still in full 3D though. The other big change is that you can play as a female protagonist instead of the male default, which completely changes the game’s social links to use different characters, and also switches up the music. For my money, some of the FeMC’s music pieces are actually better than the standard P3 soundtrack, but both are really good regardless.

I originally wanted to get a PSP from my friend and play P3P, but P3FES has been surprisingly fun so far.

But no matter what, definitely try Persona 4 at some point- it’s even better than P3. (P4 is getting a Playstation Vita re-release, which supposedly will add on a bunch of new content, so if you have a Vita get that version).

Read full topic

item.title: Quantic Dream's "Kara" Tech Demo
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
imbusy:

I don’t get what you’re so mad about. The PS3 is old -> the textures are low quality. There’s not much you can do about it and high quality graphics needs high resolution textures. The demo is cool, but it’s no better than pretty much anything else available on the PS3. I just can’t understand when people say their minds were blown. Good job? Yes. Groundbreaking? No.

I guess you completely missed the point of the video then.

Read full topic

item.title: Quantic Dream's "Kara" Tech Demo
item.dc:creator: Spooks
item.description:
GamesRadar actually has a very nice article about the demo I read a little while ago that sums up my thoughts of the ordeal nicely, you can read it here.
[COLOR=‘Black’]JASON
As far as the tech goes, it’s pretty impressive I guess? By today’s standards ‘pretty impressive’ doesn’t really say much, I was far more wooed with the glimpses of in-engine footage in the AC3 trailer. But hey, that… shader skin thing?.. was nice, I guess?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
imbusy:

textures are low resolution.

I’m starting to think that complaint is just a thing people just throw in for the fuck of it. Every single game that comes out, someone complains about texres as if it was the determining factor of all graphics all the time. Get this: texture resolutions in videogames are small. WOAH! Just like poly counts are low! Wow!

item.title: Quantic Dream's "Kara" Tech Demo
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
It was a tech demo, silly, its only purpose was to show the improved animation tech, graphics were secondary.

Besides, that tech demo is one year old and made on an unoptimized and incomplete new engine.

Read full topic

item.title: Quantic Dream's "Kara" Tech Demo
item.dc:creator: imbusy
item.description:
k3nny1550:

How the fuck were those poor graphics?!?

The animations and modelling work are good, but the graphics algorithms are old and cheap and the textures are low resolution. In addition, that subtle glow is just trying to cover it all up. TBH, they set up the scene so that they wouldn’t have to do anything expensive or new.

Read full topic
